sen.j: 官庁集中計画（かんちょうしゅうちゅうけいかく）は明治時代の首都計画で、議事堂や官庁などを霞が関付近に集中し、パリやベルリンに並ぶ華麗なバロック都市を建設しようとした。
sen.e: The government offices centralizing plan was the city plan of the capital of Tokyo which was organized in the Meiji period; it planned to build a splendid baroque city which would be equivalent to Paris or Berlin by centralizing official buildings such as the Congress Hall and government offices around Kasumigaseki area in Tokyo.

sen.j: 計画の中心者井上馨の失脚により挫折した。
sen.e: The plan was cancelled because the leader of the plan, Kaoru INOUE fell from power.

sen.j: 外務大臣井上馨は条約改正のため鹿鳴館外交と呼ばれる欧化政策を採り、その一環として壮大な首都建設を構想した。
sen.e: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Kaoru INOUE employed the policy of Europeanization, which was called the Rokumeikan (Rokumeikan guest house) diplomacy, which aimed at revising the European treaties; the grand capital construction was an integral part of the policy.

Minister of Foreign Affairs, Kaoru INOUE employed the policy of Europeanization which was called the Rokumeikan (Rokumeikan guest house) diplomacy to aim at revising the European treaties and the grand capital construction was an integral part of the policy.

sen.e: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Kaoru INOUE employed the policy of Europeanization which was called the Rokumeikan (Rokumeikan guest house) diplomacy to aim at revising the European treaties and the grand capital construction was an integral part of the policy.

sen.j: こうして1886年（明治19年）、内閣に臨時建築局を設置し、井上が総裁に、三島通庸が副総裁（警視総監兼務）に、またドイツ帰りの建築家・松崎万長が工事部長に就任した。
sen.e: Thus, a Temporary Architectural Bureau was formed in the Cabinet; INOUE took the office of the president; Michitsune MISHIMA took the office the vice-president (the additional post to the Tokyo Metropolitan Police commissioner); Tsumunaga MATSUZAKI, an architect who had returned from Germany, took the office of the director of construction.

sen.e: Thus, a Temporary Architectural Bureau was formed in the Cabinet in 1886; Inoue assumed the premiership, Michitsune MISHIMA assumed office of the vice-president (concurrently the Tokyo Metropolitan Police commissioner), and Tsumunaga MATSUZAKI, an architect who had returned from Germany, assumed office of the director of construction.
sen.cmt: in 1886の訳漏れ。INOUE→Inoue, take the office→assumed～, the additional post→concurrently, としました。
sen.e: Thus, a Temporary Architectural Bureau was formed in the Cabinet in 1886; Inoue assumed the premiership, Michitsune MISHIMA assumed office of the vice-president (concurrently the Tokyo Metropolitan Police commissioner), and Tsumunaga MATSUZAKI, an architect who had returned from Germany, assumed office of the director of construction.

sen.j: そしてドイツの建築家ヘルマン・エンデとヴィルヘルム・ベックマンに都市計画及び主要建造物の設計を依頼。
sen.e: They commissioned the German architects, Hermann Ende and Wilhelm Böckmann to be responsible for city planning and the architectural design of primary buildings.
They commissioned the German architects, Hermann ENDE and Wilhelm BÖCKMANN to be responsible for city planning and the architectural design of primary buildings.
sen.cmt: Ende, Böckmann を大文字にしました。
sen.e: They commissioned the German architects, Hermann ENDE and Wilhelm BÖCKMANN to be responsible for city planning and the architectural design of primary buildings.

sen.j: 同年、ベックマンらドイツ人技師が来日し、一方日本からは建築家の渡辺譲、妻木頼黄、河合浩蔵及び職人たちがドイツに留学した。
sen.e: In the same year, Böckmann and other German architects came to Japan, and the Japanese architects, Yuzuru WATANABE, Yorinaka TSUMAKI, Kozo KAWAI and artisans went to Germany to study.

sen.j: 来日したベックマンは、築地から霞が関に都市の中心軸を置き、中央駅、劇場、博覧会場、官庁街、新宮殿、国会議事堂などを配する壮大な都市計画を立てた。
sen.e: When Böckmann came to Japan, he undertook the grandiose project of city planning of Tokyo; it was to set the center of the capital around the area from Chikuji to Kasumigaseki, and to place buildings, such as a central station, theater, venue for exhibitions, government offices, new palace and congress hall.

When Böckmann came to Japan, he undertook the grandiose project of city planning of Tokyo; it was to set the center of the capital around the area from Tsukiji to Kasumigaseki, and to place buildings, such as a central station, a theater, a venue for exhibitions, government offices, a new palace and a congress hall.

sen.j: しかしこの計画は、財政上とうてい実現困難なものであった。
sen.e: However, there were financial constraints on the project.

sen.j: 次いで、ベックマンの推薦で東京の水道計画の技術顧問としてジェームス・ホープレヒトが招かれるが、来日早々ホープレヒトはベックマンの計画案を大幅に縮小した。
sen.e: Subsequently, James Hobrecht who was recommended by Böckmann was invited as a technical adviser of the water project for Tokyo; once Hobrecht arrived, he downscaled Böckmann's project to a large extent.

Subsequently, James HOBRECHT who was recommended by Böckmann was invited as a technical adviser of the water project in Tokyo, but once Hobrecht arrived, he downscaled Böckmann's project to a large extent.

sen.j: その後にエンデが来日して縮小案に基づき、計画案を修正した。
sen.e: Then, Ende came to Japan and amended the project according to the downscaled one.

sen.j: その後、井上が条約改正に失敗し、外務大臣を辞任（1887年）したため、官庁集中計画そのものが頓挫することになった。
sen.e: After that, INOUE resigned as Minister of Foreign Affairs (in 1887) due to his failure in the treaty revision; this caused to set back the government offices centralizing plan.

sen.j: 臨時建築局は内務省に移管され、ドイツへの留学生は帰国を命じられた。
sen.e: The Temporary Architectural Bureau was transferred to the Ministry of the Interior; Japanese students who were studying in Germany were ordered to return to Japan.
